member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG
member.summary: The SYNCMGRFLAG enumeration values are used in the method to indicate how the synchronization event was initiated.

member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG.SYNCMGRFLAG_CONNECT
member.summary: Synchronization was initiated by a network connect event.

member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG.SYNCMGRFLAG_PENDINGDISCONNECT
member.summary: Synchronization was initiated by a pending network disconnect event.

member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG.SYNCMGRFLAG_MANUAL
member.summary: Synchronization was initiated manually by the end user.

member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG.SYNCMGRFLAG_SCHEDULED
member.summary: Synchronization was initiated by a scheduled update event.

member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG.SYNCMGRFLAG_SETTINGS
member.summary: Synchronization was initiated for configuration purposes only in the System Properties dialog box.

member.name: SYNCMGRFLAG.SYNCMGRFLAG_MAYBOTHERUSER
member.summary: Interaction with the user is permitted. The application is allowed to show user interface elements and interact with the user. If this flag is not set, the application must not display any user interface elements other than using the interface. If an application cannot complete the synchronization without displaying user interface elements and this flag is not set, the application fails the synchronization.
